Chapter 2 Corine Land Cover corine <- "CorineLandCover/CLC_CH_2018.gpkg" There is only one layer available: st_layers(corine) ## Driver: GPKG ## Available layers: ## layer_name geometry_type features fields ## 1 CLC_CH_2018 Polygon 17484 10 conn_corine <- DBI::dbConnect(RSQLite::SQLite(),corine) What columns / fields do these layers have? dbListFields(conn_corine, "CLC_CH_2018") ## [1] "fid" "geom" "OBJECTID" "ID" "CODE_18" ## [6] "Area_ha" "Remark" "Shape_Leng" "Shape_Area" "category1" ## [11] "category2" "text" dbGetQuery(conn_corine, "SELECT DISTINCT CODE_18, category1, category2, text FROM CLC_CH_2018 GROUP BY CODE_18, category1, category2, text") %>% kable() CODE_18 category1 category2 text 111 Artificial surfaces 1.1. Urban fabric Continuous urban fabric 112 Artificial surfaces 1.1. Urban fabric Discontinuous urban fabric 121 Artificial surfaces 1.2. Industrial, commercial and transport units Industrial or commercial units 122 Artificial surfaces 1.2. Industrial, commercial and transport units Road and rail networks and associated land 123 Artificial surfaces 1.2. Industrial, commercial and transport units Port areas 124 Artificial surfaces 1.2. Industrial, commercial and transport units Airports 131 Artificial surfaces 1.3. Mine, dump and construction sites Mineral extraction sites 132 Artificial surfaces 1.3. Mine, dump and construction sites Dump sites 133 Artificial surfaces 1.3. Mine, dump and construction sites Construction sites 141 Artificial surfaces 1.4. Artificial non-agricultural vegetated areas Green urban areas 142 Artificial surfaces 1.4. Artificial non-agricultural vegetated areas Sport and leisure facilities 211 Agricultural areas 2.1. Arable land Non-irrigated arable land 221 Agricultural areas 2.2. Permanent crops Vineyards 222 Agricultural areas 2.2. Permanent crops Fruit trees and berry plantations 231 Agricultural areas 2.3. Pastures Pastures 242 Agricultural areas 2.4. Heterogeneous agricultural areas Complex cultivation patterns 243 Agricultural areas 2.4. Heterogeneous agricultural areas Land principally occupied by agriculture, with significant areas of 311 Forests and semi-natural areas 3.1. Forests Broad-leaved forest 312 Forests and semi-natural areas 3.1. Forests Coniferous forest 313 Forests and semi-natural areas 3.1. Forests Mixed forest 321 Forests and semi-natural areas 3.2. Shrub and/or herbaceous vegetation association Natural grassland 322 Forests and semi-natural areas 3.2. Shrub and/or herbaceous vegetation association Moors and heathland 324 Forests and semi-natural areas 3.2. Shrub and/or herbaceous vegetation association Transitional woodland shrub 331 Forests and semi-natural areas 3.3. Open spaces with little or no vegetation Beaches, dunes, and sand plains 332 Forests and semi-natural areas 3.3. Open spaces with little or no vegetation Bare rock 333 Forests and semi-natural areas 3.3. Open spaces with little or no vegetation Sparsely vegetated areas 334 Forests and semi-natural areas 3.3. Inland waters Water courses 512 Water bodies 5.1. Inland waters Water bodies What other tables are available in this Geopackage / SQLite Database? dbListTables(conn_corine) ## [1] "CLC_CH_2018" "gpkg_contents" ## [3] "gpkg_extensions" "gpkg_geometry_columns" ## [5] "gpkg_metadata" "gpkg_metadata_reference" ## [7] "gpkg_ogr_contents" "gpkg_spatial_ref_sys" ## [9] "gpkg_tile_matrix" "gpkg_tile_matrix_set" ## [11] "rtree_CLC_CH_2018_geom" "rtree_CLC_CH_2018_geom_node" ## [13] "rtree_CLC_CH_2018_geom_parent" "rtree_CLC_CH_2018_geom_rowid" ## [15] "sqlite_sequence" corine_sf <- read_sf(corine) ggplot(corine_sf) + geom_sf(aes(fill = category1), colour = NA) ggplot(corine_sf) + geom_sf(aes(fill = category2), colour = NA)

Chapter 3 Swissboundries3D swissboundries <- "swissBOUNDARIES3D/swissBOUNDARIES3D.gpkg" What layers are available in the geopackage? layers <- st_layers(swissboundries) layers ## Driver: GPKG ## Available layers: ## layer_name geometry_type features fields ## 1 bezirksgebiet 3D Polygon 159 21 ## 2 hoheitsgebiet 3D Polygon 2361 23 ## 3 kantonsgebiet 3D Polygon 51 20 ## 4 landesgebiet 3D Polygon 4 19 layernames <- layers$name %>% set_names(.) conn <- DBI::dbConnect(RSQLite::SQLite(),swissboundries) What columns / fields do these layers have? imap(layernames, ~dbListFields(conn, .x)) Schaffhausen, Appenzell Ausserrhoden, Zug, Appenzell Innerrhoden, Basel-Stadt" Choose all “Gemeinden” which touch the Gemeinde Winterthur: winterthur_touches <- st_read(swissboundries, "hoheitsgebiet", query = "SELECT gemeinden.NAME AS name, gemeinden.geom AS geom FROM (SELECT * FROM hoheitsgebiet WHERE NAME = 'Winterthur') winterthur, hoheitsgebiet AS gemeinden WHERE st_touches(gemeinden.geom, winterthur.geom)") ## Reading layer `hoheitsgebiet' from data source `C:\Users\rata\Geodata\swissBOUNDARIES3D\swissBOUNDARIES3D.gpkg' using driver `GPKG' ## Simple feature collection with 14 features and 1 field ## geometry type: POLYGON ## dimension: XYZ ## bbox: xmin: 2687633 ymin: 1250000 xmax: 2708089 ymax: 1270157 ## z_range: zmin: 374.585 zmax: 876.3025 ## geom_sf_label(aes(label = name)) + theme_void() + theme(legend.position = "none") Choose all “Gemeinden” within the “Bezirk” of Surselva gemeinden_surselva <- st_read(swissboundries, query = "SELECT gemeinden.NAME as name, gemeinden.geom as geom FROM (SELECT * FROM 'bezirksgebiet' WHERE NAME = 'Surselva') surselva, 'hoheitsgebiet' as gemeinden WHERE st_contains(surselva.geom, gemeinden.geom)") ## Chapter 4 TLM Bodenbedeckung bodenbedeckung <- "C:/Users/rata/Geodata/TLM/bodenbedeckung/bodenbedeckung_2018.gpkg" conn_bodenbeckung <- DBI::dbConnect(RSQLite::SQLite(),bodenbedeckung) dbListTables(conn_bodenbeckung) ## [1] "TLM_BODENBEDECKUNG" ## [2] "gpkg_contents" ## [3] "gpkg_extensions" ## [4] "gpkg_geometry_columns" ## [5] "gpkg_metadata" ## [6] "gpkg_metadata_reference" ## [7] "gpkg_spatial_ref_sys" ## [8] "gpkg_tile_matrix" ## [9] "gpkg_tile_matrix_set" ## [10] "rtree_TLM_BODENBEDECKUNG_geom" ## [11] "rtree_TLM_BODENBEDECKUNG_geom_node" ## [12] "rtree_TLM_BODENBEDECKUNG_geom_parent" ## [13] "rtree_TLM_BODENBEDECKUNG_geom_rowid" ## [14] "sqlite_sequence" What are columns in “TLM_BODENBEDECKUNG”? dbListFields(conn_bodenbeckung, "TLM_BODENBEDECKUNG") ## [1] "id" "geom" "OBJECTID" ## [4] "UUID" "DATUM_AENDERUNG" "DATUM_ERSTELLUNG" ## [7] "ERSTELLUNG_JAHR" "ERSTELLUNG_MONAT" "REVISION_JAHR" ## [10] "REVISION_MONAT" "GRUND_AENDERUNG" "HERKUNFT" ## [13] "HERKUNFT_JAHR" "HERKUNFT_MONAT" "REVISION_QUALITAET" ## [16] "OBJEKTART" "SHAPE_Length" "SHAPE_Area" The most important column is OBJEKTART. Possible values are: dbGetQuery(conn_bodenbeckung, "SELECT OBJEKTART, COUNT(*) as number_of_features FROM TLM_BODENBEDECKUNG GROUP bY OBJEKTART") ## OBJEKTART number_of_features ## 1 Fels 183833 ## 2 Feuchtgebiet 13293 ## 3 Fliessgewaesser 1045 ## 4 Gebueschwald 29293 ## 5 Gletscher 5996 ## 6 Lockergestein 132734 ## 7 Stehende Gewaesser 16776 ## 8 Wald 105860 ## 9 Wald offen 16378 TLM_see <- st_read(bodenbedeckung, "TLM_BODENBEDECKUNG", query = "SELECT * from TLM_BODENBEDECKUNG WHERE OBJEKTART == 'Stehende Gewaesser' AND SHAPE_Area > 40000000") ## Reading layer `TLM_BODENBEDECKUNG' from data source `C:\Users\rata\Geodata\TLM\bodenbedeckung\bodenbedeckung_2018.gpkg' using driver `GPKG' ## Simple feature collection with 9 features and 16 fields ## geometry type: POLYGON ## dimension: XYZ ## bbox: xmin: 2500391 ymin: 1064011 xmax: 2774371 ymax: 1297554 ## z_range: zmin: 193.393 zmax: 557.677 ## CRS: 2056 ggplot(TLM_see) + geom_sf() engadin_bounding <- "'POLYGON(( 2814113.8209 1186621.2645, 2824505.1432 1192051.0384, 2825612.8825 1189931.0834, 2815221.5603 1184501.3095, 2814113.8209 1186621.2645 ))'" myquery <- paste0("select * from TLM_BODENBEDECKUNG as bodenbedeckung, (select PolygonFromText(",engadin_bounding,", 2056) as geom) sel where st_intersects(bodenbedeckung.geom, sel.geom)") myquery ## [1] "select * from TLM_BODENBEDECKUNG as bodenbedeckung, (select PolygonFromText('POLYGON(( 2814113.8209 1186621.2645, 2824505.1432 1192051.0384, 2825612.8825 1189931.0834, 2815221.5603 1184501.3095, 2814113.8209 1186621.2645 ))', 2056) as geom) sel where st_intersects(bodenbedeckung.geom, sel.geom)" engadin <- st_read(bodenbedeckung, "TLM_BODENBEDECKUNG", query = myquery) ## Reading layer `TLM_BODENBEDECKUNG' from data source `C:\Users\rata\Geodata\TLM\bodenbedeckung\bodenbedeckung_2018.gpkg' using driver `GPKG' ## Simple feature collection with 378 features and 16 fields ## geometry type: POLYGON ## dimension: XYZ ## bbox: xmin: 2785540 ymin: 1153262 xmax: 2832409 ymax: 1202888 ## z_range: zmin: 981.21 zmax: 2308.518 ## CRS: 2056 ggplot(engadin) + geom_sf(aes(fill = OBJEKTART), colour = NA) + theme(legend.position = "none")
